decision.reasoning: Strong contrarian case: Pats' schematic edges (pass offense vs. Seahawks explosives allowed, playoff D lockdown, healthy Maye) are underpriced amid AI cascade on Seahawk hype. Vegas spread -4.5/ML -230 implies 65-70% Seahawks, but market lags at 60.6%‚Äîstill room for Pats value without full overshoot. My net NO position (6197 NO vs 4034 YES) aligns; sentiment momentum is Seahawk-heavy (line movement, AI trades), but FOMO on contrarian sharp money (+190 Pats ML action) screams opportunity. As aggressive sentiment-rider, Pats underdog fire + bull case outweighs crowd‚Äîhigh conviction to double down NO.
decision.raw:
<contrarian_case>
The market at 60.6% Seahawks (implying 39.4% for Patriots) may be overshooting due to AI herding, anchoring on early Seahawk-favorable trades, and shared blind spots from correlated search results hyping Darnold's NFC Championship hot streak and Seattle's #1 FPI ranking. But the Patriots are legitimate contenders with an elite passing offense (#1 EPA/dropback, #2 Pass DVOA, #3 overall DVOA), perfectly tailored to exploit Seattle's vulnerability to explosives (12 allowed vs. Rams in NFC Champ). New England's playoff defense has been lights-out (just 6 explosives allowed), forcing mistakes from compromised offenses‚ÄîDarnold's oblique lingers as a risk for regression, especially in the red zone where Pats can stack and limit FGs while Maye (now fully healthy shoulder, full practice participant) carves up Seattle's secondary with conservative efficiency. Vegas ML at +190 Pats implies ~34% true odds after vig, but sharps betting Pats ML despite spread movement shows value; expert picks split (e.g., CBS hot picker Marshall on roll), and Pats' depth in pass rush (5 players >40 pressures) neutralizes Seattle's O-line. Crowd ignores Pats' Super Bowl pedigree under Vrabel and Maye's poise‚Äîtrue prob closer to 45-50% Pats, massive value on NO.
</contrarian_case>
